content:
DSBs in telomeric regions promote chromosome end-to-end fusions, leading to breakage-fusion-bridge cycles, and the resulting complex rearrangements create neoantigens that may be targetable by immunotherapies.  
*Supporting evidence:* Telomere dysfunction leads to DSBs and chromosomal instability in cancer [Artandi 2010]. Chromosomal instability generates immunogenic neoantigens [McGranahan 2016, Cell].

---
